message: My question is more like open discussion for Java Developers, Does anyone here experienced unexpected behavior while using the conditional operator (aka ternary operator) ?

data.message: I've only ever used it once to solve a competition problem, and I found it syntactically weird looking, so I never used it again. What kind of unexpected behaviour are you running into, though?
I always use it , but i did not face unexpected behavior before .

I use it a lot in C#. Your problem may be caused by wrong assumption for precedence, like 5 + x== 10? 20 : 10 + 30; 
If your statement looks something like this make sure it means what you want

Use parentheses to assign the precedence of the expression. Also, check in the "definite assignment " of the identifiers. finally,  stop beg the question and tell us clearly what is your question? !!!

First of all sorry for the late response, I was trying to append a string, and I used ternary operator to check the returned value(String) of a getter(if it's null or not), it throws a null pointer exception, Althogh I used the same syntax with another getter of the same type, it's value was null but it didn't throw any exceptions and continue the condition normally
can u write the code here ?
